Minneapolis, MN Metro > Coon Rapids > Restaurants > Green Mill Restaurant Green Mill Restaurant (763) 712-1200 12475 Riverdale Blvd NW , Coon Rapids , MN | Directions 55433 45.187200 -93.337600 View Website Menu Share Save Own this Business? Recommend this business? Thumbs Up Thumbs Down ? 34 % 100 3 3 Votes Add a Photo Cuisine: Italian , Pizza Price: $ Categories: Restaurants View More Payment Methods: MasterCard, Visa Restaurant Special Features: Group Dining , Family-Friendly Dining View Less Site Feedback Overview Tips (3) Photos (0) Write a Tip for Green Mill Restaurant Sign in to Write a Tip Write a Tip... optional
Tips for Green Mill Restaurant Recommends Dan H. Joined 6 months ago 5.0 January 08, 2012 Green Mill is Brand New Again. I am up in the area some for meetings and have been at the Coon Rapids Green Mill lately and noticed it is completely new. Everything was really up to date. The food was spectacular and the service was incredible. Even the manager, Jason, came by to say hi. What I will like in the future is using their meeting room in the back, another great update to the place. I am in love with their 1/2 baked pizzas which I always get when I go to these locations. The place is kinda hard to see from Main Street but still in back right by Target. Great job Green Mill. Keep it up! … View More View Less 0 Heart Doesn't Recommend Hags82 Joined 9 months ago 2.0 October 01, 2011 Meh. We have always loved Green Mill, so we were pretty excited to have one open in Coon Rapids. When we got there, no one was there to greet us or seat us. After a while we just sat ourselves. We wanted to sit in the bar, but they definitely do not have enough seating in there. It was full and it wasn't even busy there. We settled for the main dining room. If they were going for upscale fast food restaurant, they hit the nail on the head here. It reminds me of the updated McDonalds. Cheap tables and chairs and the decor is gross. Our waitress was less than accomodating. She never stopped at our table unless she was dropping off plates/utensils. We wanted to drink more and wanted to get some extra ranch for our wings. We didn't get either. Again, it wasn't even busy. I grade this experience with an F. … View More View Less 0 Heart Contributor Joined 9 years ago August 08, 2008 Local pizza chain continues to bring in droves of families and friends with gourmet pies and pastas.. In Short From sports fans whooping it up at the bar to kids playing at tables and high booths, Green Mill is a rambunctious scene. The decor is surprisingly nice, given the family-friendly vibe: mahogany wood paneling, decorative glass dividers, brick walls and artsy glass light sconces. Most everyone comes for the pizza, whether it's deep-dish, stuffed or on a cracker-thin seasoned crust. Other dishes include seafood pastas and hot Italian subs. … View More View Less 0 Heart
